requirement_tested: Display a homepage with navigation to Menus, Private Poker Room, Events & Promotions, and Reservations/Purchases
user_persona: A first-time visitor curious about what The All-In Bourbon Bar offers.
user_goal: To navigate from the homepage to the Menus section.

narrative_steps.title: Landing on Homepage
narrative_steps.description: Sarah opens the website and sees the homepage with a header bar.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The homepage loads with a header containing navigation links: Menus, Private Poker Room, Events & Promotions, and Reservations/Purchases. Background is peach puff with indian red accents.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating to Menus
narrative_steps.description: Sarah wants to see what drinks are available and clicks the 'Menus' link.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The page scrolls or navigates to the Menus section or a dedicated Menus page.

requirement_tested: Showcase bourbon and cocktail menus with descriptions and pricing fetched dynamically from backend
user_persona: A customer interested in exploring drink options before visiting.
user_goal: To view the bourbon menu with accurate prices and descriptions.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Menu Page
narrative_steps.description: Mike clicks on the 'Menus' link from the homepage.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The Menus page loads showing a grid/list of items with names, descriptions, prices, and images. All content is styled with peach puff containers and indian red accents.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Dynamic Content
narrative_steps.description: Mike scrolls through the menu to find his favorite bourbon.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All menu items display dynamically fetched data from the backend without any hardcoded values.

requirement_tested: Introduce the membership-only private poker room with details and access requirements
user_persona: A potential member wanting to learn about exclusive offerings.
user_goal: To understand how to gain access to the private poker room.

narrative_steps.title: Discovering Poker Room Section
narrative_steps.description: Emily clicks on 'Private Poker Room' from the navigation.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Private Poker Room' link.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: She lands on a section/page detailing the private poker room with images, amenities, and membership requirements. Styled with brand colors.

narrative_steps.title: Attempting Access Without Authentication
narrative_steps.description: Curious, Emily tries to access more details by clicking 'Access Now'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A login/signup modal appears prompting her to authenticate since she's not logged in.

requirement_tested: List upcoming events and ongoing promotions with dates, descriptions, and registration options
user_persona: A local resident looking for weekend entertainment.
user_goal: To find out about current events and sign up for one.

narrative_steps.title: Browsing Events & Promotions
narrative_steps.description: James visits the 'Events & Promotions' section from the main navigation.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: He sees a list of cards/timeline entries representing events and promotions with titles, dates, and descriptions. Styled appropriately with brand colors.

narrative_steps.title: Registering for an Event
narrative_steps.description: James finds an interesting event and decides to register.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the registration CTA associated with an event card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: He is either redirected to a registration form or the card expands to reveal a registration option.

requirement_tested: Enable users to make online reservations for tables or private poker room sessions
user_persona: A customer planning a night out with friends.
user_goal: To book a table reservation for Saturday evening.

narrative_steps.title: Initiating Reservation Process
narrative_steps.description: Anna clicks on 'Reservations/Purchases' to plan her dinner visit.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: She is taken to a page where she can choose to reserve a table or schedule a poker session.

narrative_steps.title: Filling Out Reservation Form
narrative_steps.description: Anna fills out the form selecting 'Table' as her reservation type.
narrative_steps.action: Fill in personal info, select date/time, specify number of guests, choose 'Table', then click submit.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Upon submission, a confirmation message appears indicating successful receipt of her reservation request.

requirement_tested: Allow users to purchase items from the menu online with secure checkout functionality
user_persona: A regular patron who prefers ordering ahead.
user_goal: To buy two cocktails online for pickup.

narrative_steps.title: Adding Items to Cart
narrative_steps.description: David browses the menu and selects two cocktails he likes.
narrative_steps.action: Click 'Add to Cart' icons next to two cocktail items.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Each item gets added to a visible shopping cart indicator using indian red styling.

narrative_steps.title: Proceeding to Secure Checkout
narrative_steps.description: Ready to complete his order, David clicks 'Checkout'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A secure payment interface opens, allowing him to finalize his purchase using integrated payment gateway (Stripe/PayPal).

requirement_tested: Implement responsive design with peach puff container backgrounds and indian red component visuals
user_persona: A mobile user checking the bar's offerings while commuting.
user_goal: To comfortably browse the site on a small screen device.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Site on Mobile Device
narrative_steps.description: Lisa opens the website on her smartphone.
narrative_steps.action: Load the homepage on a mobile browser.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The layout adapts responsively, maintaining readability and usability. Peach puff backgrounds and indian red accents remain consistent across devices.

requirement_tested: Include a contact section with location, hours, and customer service information
user_persona: A tourist unfamiliar with the area seeking directions.
user_goal: To locate the bar and confirm its operating hours.

narrative_steps.title: Finding Contact Information
narrative_steps.description: Tom scrolls to the bottom of the homepage looking for contact details.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: He sees address, phone number, business hours, embedded map, and support emailâ€”all presented within a peach puff background and indian red headings.

narrative_steps.title: Interacting with Embedded Map
narrative_steps.description: Wanting precise directions, Tom clicks on the embedded map.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the embedded Google Map.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The map opens in full view or a new tab, helping him get directions easily.

requirement_tested: Provide user authentication for accessing member-only areas like the private poker room details
user_persona: A registered member wanting to access exclusive content.
user_goal: To log in and view private poker room details.

narrative_steps.title: Initiating Login Flow
narrative_steps.description: Alex, a known member, wants to access the private poker room info.
narrative_steps.action: Click on 'Private Poker Room' > then 'Access Now'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A login modal appears styled with brand colors.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting Valid Credentials
narrative_steps.description: Alex enters his correct login details.
narrative_steps.action: Enter valid email/password and click submit.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Authentication succeeds, granting access to the private poker room details page.

requirement_tested: Support dynamic content updates via a backend connected to an external PostgreSQL database
user_persona: A returning visitor expecting updated event listings.
user_goal: To see fresh events listed after some were recently added.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Updated Events
narrative_steps.description: Jordan returns to the site after hearing about new events.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Newly added events appear automatically due to real-time fetching from the PostgreSQL-connected backend.

requirement_tested: Ensure all data is fetched from backend APIs; no hardcoded or mock data in the frontend
user_persona: A developer verifying that frontend adheres to clean architecture principles.
user_goal: To confirm that no static data exists in the rendered UI components.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Data Sources
narrative_steps.description: Developer inspects network activity when loading the menus page.
narrative_steps.action: Open DevTools Network tab and reload the Menus page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: API calls are made to /api/menus endpoint; no static data found in JSX templates or source files.

requirement_tested: Configure environment variables for database connection: DB_HOST, DB_PORT, DB_USERNAME, DB_PASSWORD, DB_NAME
user_persona: A deployment engineer preparing the app for production.
user_goal: To verify that the backend connects properly using configured environment variables.

narrative_steps.title: Verifying Environment Configuration
narrative_steps.description: Engineer checks the deployed backend logs during startup.
narrative_steps.action: Review backend console/logs on server start.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Logs indicate successful connection to PostgreSQL using values from .env file matching specified variables: DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, etc.

requirement_tested: Set up package.json scripts: `npm run install:all` for frontend and backend installation, `npm run dev` for concurrent development startup
user_persona: A new contributor setting up the project locally.
user_goal: To quickly install dependencies and launch both frontend and backend together.

narrative_steps.title: Installing Dependencies Concurrently
narrative_steps.description: Jamie clones the repo and sets up the environment.
narrative_steps.action: Run command `npm run install:all` from root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend folders install their respective dependencies simultaneously.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Development Servers Together
narrative_steps.description: Jamie now wants to run the entire stack for local development.
narrative_steps.action: Run command `npm run dev` from root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Frontend and backend servers start concurrently, ready for active development.

requirement_tested: Implement API endpoints for menus, events, promotions, reservations, and purchases
user_persona: A QA tester validating API behavior independently of frontend.
user_goal: To ensure each required API endpoint responds correctly.

narrative_steps.title: Testing Menus Endpoint
narrative_steps.description: Tester makes a direct GET request to the menus API.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Returns JSON list of menu items with proper structure and status code 200.

narrative_steps.title: Testing Reservations Submission
narrative_steps.description: Tester submits a sample reservation payload.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Server accepts the data and returns a success confirmation with appropriate status code.

requirement_tested: Design UI components that align with branding colors: peach puff for containers and indian red for visual elements
user_persona: A designer auditing the UI consistency post-development.
user_goal: To validate that all UI components reflect the defined brand palette.

narrative_steps.title: Auditing Visual Consistency
narrative_steps.description: Designer reviews various pages for color adherence.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All container backgrounds consistently use peach puff (#FFDAB9), and interactive/highlight elements use indian red (#CD5C5C).
